snippet: Two medications could help tens of thousands of alcoholics but are rarely prescribed, researchers reported on Tuesday.
abstract: Study published in journal of American Medical Assn, or JAMA, finds that medications naltrexone and acamprosate could help tens of thousands of alcoholics quit drinking, yet the drugs are rarely prescribed.
lead_paragraph: Two medications could help tens of thousands of alcoholics but are rarely prescribed, researchers reported on Tuesday.

headline.main: Drugs to Aid Alcoholics See Little Use, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Drugs to Aid Alcoholics See Little Use, Study Finds

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations
